meanings.definition: Mesmerizers (noun): People who captivate or fascinate others.
meanings.sent1: The mesmerizers in the play had everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The singer was one of the mesmerizers at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The mesmerizers at the magic show made the audience gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling skills were like mesmerizers, holding us spellbound.
meanings.sent5: The mesmerizers in the movie were so captivating that I couldn't look away.

meanings.definition: Mesmerizers (verb): To captivate or fascinate someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician mesmerizers the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The painting mesmerizers anyone who gazes at it.
meanings.sent3: The way she dances mesmerizers even the grumpiest of people.
meanings.sent4: The sunset mesmerizers me every evening with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The author's words mesmerizers readers, drawing them into the story.
